- ARTIST
Michael Joseph Jackson (August 29, 1958 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ June 25, 2009), often referred to as the King of Pop,  was the most successful entertainer of all time. His contribution to music, dance, and fashion, along with a much-publicized personal life, made him a global figure in popular culture for over four decades. The seventh child of the Jackson family, he debuted on the professional music scene along with his brothers as a member of The Jackson 5, then the Jacksons in 1964, and began his solo career in 1971.
In the early 1980s, Jackson became a dominant figure in popular music. 
He has sold over 750 million records worldwide (Thriller is the best-selling album of all time with more than 110 million)
